WITH sn_objects AS (
    SELECT DISTINCT p.oid
    FROM probability p
    JOIN object o ON p.oid = o.oid
    WHERE p.classifier_name = 'stamp_classifier'
      AND p.class_name = 'SN'
      AND p.ranking = 1  -- Most likely class
      AND o.firstmjd BETWEEN 60173.0 AND 60177.0  -- August 17 to August 21
      AND (p.probability > 0.5 OR o.ndet >= 2)
)
SELECT o.*
FROM object o
JOIN sn_objects s ON o.oid = s.oid;

WITH sn_objects AS (
    SELECT DISTINCT p.oid
    FROM probability p
    JOIN object o ON p.oid = o.oid
    WHERE p.classifier_name = 'stamp_classifier'
      AND p.class_name = 'SN'
      AND p.ranking = 1  -- Most likely class

      AND (p.probability > 0.5 OR o.ndet >= 2)
)
SELECT o.*
FROM object o
WHERE o.oid IN (SELECT oid FROM sn_objects);

-- Return objects classified as Cepheid by lc_classifier with high probability and many detections
SELECT 
    o.oid,
    o.meanra,
    o.meandec,
    o.ndet,
    o.firstmjd,
    o.deltajd,
    o.g_r_max,
    p.classifier_name,
    p.class_name,
    p.ranking,
    p.probability
FROM 
    object o
JOIN 
    probability p ON o.oid = p.oid
WHERE 
    p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier'
    AND p.class_name = 'CEP'  -- Cepheid class
    AND p.probability > 0.76
    AND p.ranking = 1  -- Most likely class
    AND o.ndet >= 100  -- Objects with 100 or more detections
ORDER BY 
    p.probability DESC;

-- Query to find objects classified as Cepheid with high probability
SELECT

WHERE

WITH agn_objects AS (
    SELECT DISTINCT p.oid
    FROM probability p
    WHERE p.class_name = 'AGN'
    AND p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier'
    AND p.ranking = 1
),
r_band_detections AS (
    SELECT oid, COUNT(*) as r_count
    FROM detection
    WHERE fid = 2 -- r band
    GROUP BY oid
    HAVING COUNT(*) > 1 -- At least 2 detections to show variability
),
g_band_detections AS (
    SELECT oid, COUNT(*) as g_count
    FROM detection
    WHERE fid = 1 -- g band
    GROUP BY oid
),
r_band_variability AS (
    SELECT f.oid
    FROM feature f
    WHERE f.name = 'Std' 
    AND f.fid = 2 -- r band
    AND f.value > 0 -- Shows variability
),
g_band_variability AS (
    SELECT f.oid
    FROM feature f
    WHERE f.name = 'Std' 
    AND f.fid = 1 -- g band
    AND f.value > 0 -- Shows variability
)
SELECT o.oid, o.meanra, o.meandec, f.name as feature_name, f.value as feature_value, f.fid
FROM object o
JOIN feature f ON o.oid = f.oid
JOIN agn_objects a ON o.oid = a.oid
JOIN r_band_detections r ON o.oid = r.oid
JOIN r_band_variability rv ON o.oid = rv.oid
WHERE (o.oid NOT IN (SELECT oid FROM g_band_detections) OR 
       o.oid NOT IN (SELECT oid FROM g_band_variability))
ORDER BY f.value ASC, o.oid ASC;

WITH agn_objects AS (
    SELECT DISTINCT p.oid
    FROM probability p
    WHERE p.class_name = 'AGN'
    AND p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier'
    AND p.ranking = 1
),
r_band_detections AS (
    SELECT oid, COUNT(*) as r_count
    FROM detection
    WHERE fid = 2 -- r band
    GROUP BY oid
    HAVING COUNT(*) > 1 -- At least 2 detections to show variability
),
g_band_detections AS (
    SELECT oid, COUNT(*) as g_count
    FROM detection
    WHERE fid = 1 -- g band
    GROUP BY oid
),
r_band_variability AS (
    SELECT f.oid
    FROM feature f
    WHERE f.name = 'Std' 
    AND f.fid = 2 -- r band
    AND f.value > 0 -- Shows variability
)
SELECT f.oid, f.name, f.value, f.fid
FROM feature f
JOIN agn_objects a ON f.oid = a.oid
JOIN r_band_variability rv ON f.oid = rv.oid
JOIN r_band_detections rd ON f.oid = rd.oid
LEFT JOIN g_band_detections gd ON f.oid = gd.oid
WHERE (gd.g_count IS NULL OR gd.g_count = 0) -- No detections in g band
   OR NOT EXISTS (
      SELECT 1 
      FROM feature f2 
      WHERE f2.oid = f.oid 
      AND f2.name = 'Std' 
      AND f2.fid = 1 -- g band
      AND f2.value > 0 -- Shows variability
   )
ORDER BY f.value ASC, f.oid ASC;

-- Get AGN objects with high probability, long light curves, many detections, and significant variations
WITH agn_objects AS (
    SELECT o.oid
    FROM object o
    JOIN probability p ON o.oid = p.oid
    WHERE p.class_name = 'AGN'
      AND p.probability > 0.6
      AND p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier'
      AND p.ranking = 1
      AND o.deltajd >= 365  -- At least one year coverage
      AND o.ndet >= 20      -- At least 20 detections
),
-- Get objects with significant magnitude variations in g and r bands
mag_variations AS (
    SELECT 
        d.oid,
        MAX(CASE WHEN d.fid = 1 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) - 
        MIN(CASE WHEN d.fid = 1 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) AS delta_mag_g,
        MAX(CASE WHEN d.fid = 2 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) - 
        MIN(CASE WHEN d.fid = 2 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) AS delta_mag_r,
        MAX(CASE WHEN d.fid = 1 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) AS max_mag_g,
        MIN(CASE WHEN d.fid = 1 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) AS min_mag_g,
        MAX(CASE WHEN d.fid = 2 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) AS max_mag_r,
        MIN(CASE WHEN d.fid = 2 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) AS min_mag_r,
        COUNT(CASE WHEN d.fid = 1 THEN 1 END) AS ndet_g,
        COUNT(CASE WHEN d.fid = 2 THEN 1 END) AS ndet_r
    FROM detection d
    WHERE d.oid IN (SELECT oid FROM agn_objects)
      AND d.corrected = TRUE
    GROUP BY d.oid
    HAVING 
        (MAX(CASE WHEN d.fid = 1 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) - 
         MIN(CASE WHEN d.fid = 1 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) > 1.0)
        AND
        (MAX(CASE WHEN d.fid = 2 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) - 
         MIN(CASE WHEN d.fid = 2 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) > 0.5)
        AND
        (COUNT(CASE WHEN d.fid = 1 THEN 1 END) >= 20 OR COUNT(CASE WHEN d.fid = 2 THEN 1 END) >= 20)
)
-- Final query to get all requested information
SELECT 
    o.oid,
    f.name,
    f.value,
    f.version,
    f.fid AS feature_fid,
    o.meanra,
    o.meandec,
    o.ndet,
    mv.max_mag_g,
    mv.min_mag_g,
    mv.max_mag_r,
    mv.min_mag_r,
    mv.delta_mag_g AS delta_mag,
    mv.delta_mag_r AS delta_mag
FROM object o
JOIN mag_variations mv ON o.oid = mv.oid
JOIN feature f ON o.oid = f.oid
ORDER BY o.oid, f.name, f.fid;

-- Get AGN objects with high probability, long light curves, many detections, and significant variations
WITH agn_objects AS (
    SELECT o.oid
    FROM object o
    JOIN probability p ON o.oid = p.oid
    WHERE p.class_name = 'AGN'
      AND p.probability > 0.6
      AND p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier'
      AND p.ranking = 1
      AND o.deltajd >= 365  -- At least one year coverage
      AND o.ndet >= 20      -- At least 20 detections
),
-- Get objects with significant magnitude variations in g and r bands
mag_variations AS (
    SELECT 
        d.oid,
        MAX(CASE WHEN d.fid = 1 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) - 
        MIN(CASE WHEN d.fid = 1 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) AS delta_mag_g,
        MAX(CASE WHEN d.fid = 2 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) - 
        MIN(CASE WHEN d.fid = 2 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) AS delta_mag_r
    FROM detection d
    JOIN agn_objects a ON d.oid = a.oid
    WHERE d.corrected = TRUE
    GROUP BY d.oid
    HAVING 
        MAX(CASE WHEN d.fid = 1 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) - 
        MIN(CASE WHEN d.fid = 1 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) > 1.0
        AND
        MAX(CASE WHEN d.fid = 2 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) - 
        MIN(CASE WHEN d.fid = 2 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) > 0.5
)
-- Final selection with all requested information
SELECT 
    o.oid,
    f.value,
    f.name,
    f.version,
    f.fid AS feature_fid,
    o.meanra,
    o.meandec,
    o.ndet,
    MAX(CASE WHEN d.fid = 1 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) AS max_mag_g,
    MIN(CASE WHEN d.fid = 1 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) AS min_mag_g,
    MAX(CASE WHEN d.fid = 2 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) AS max_mag_r,
    MIN(CASE WHEN d.fid = 2 AND d.corrected = TRUE THEN d.magpsf_corr END) AS min_mag_r,
    mv.delta_mag_g AS delta_mag_g,
    mv.delta_mag_r AS delta_mag_r
FROM object o
JOIN mag_variations mv ON o.oid = mv.oid
JOIN feature f ON o.oid = f.oid
JOIN detection d ON o.oid = d.oid
WHERE d.corrected = TRUE
GROUP BY o.oid, f.value, f.name, f.version, f.fid, o.meanra, o.meandec, o.ndet, mv.delta_mag_g, mv.delta_mag_r;

-- Get fast risers with SN classification from September 1-2
WITH sn_objects AS (
    SELECT p.oid, p.probability
    FROM probability p
    WHERE p.classifier_name = 'stamp_classifier'
      AND p.class_name = 'SN'
      AND p.ranking = 1  -- Highest probability class
),
fast_risers AS (
    SELECT o.oid, m.fid AS magstat_fid, m.dmdt_first
    FROM object o
    JOIN magstat m ON o.oid = m.oid
    WHERE o.firstmjd BETWEEN 60188.0 AND 60189.0  -- Sept 1-2
      AND m.dmdt_first >= 0.25  -- Fast riser definition
)
SELECT 
    so.oid,
    so.probability,
    fr.magstat_fid,
    fr.dmdt_first AS initial_rise_estimate,
    nd.fid,
    nd.mjd,
    nd.diffmaglim
FROM sn_objects so
JOIN fast_risers fr ON so.oid = fr.oid
LEFT JOIN non_detection nd ON so.oid = nd.oid
ORDER BY so.oid
LIMIT 100;

-- Get fast risers with SN classification from early September
WITH sn_objects AS (
    SELECT p.oid, p.probability
    FROM probability p
    WHERE p.classifier_name = 'stamp_classifier'
      AND p.class_name = 'SN'
      AND p.ranking = 1  -- Highest probability class
),
fast_risers AS (
    SELECT m.oid, m.fid AS magstat_fid, m.dmdt_first
    FROM magstat m
    WHERE m.dmdt_first >= 0.25  -- Fast riser definition
)
SELECT 
    o.oid,
    sn.probability,
    fr.magstat_fid,
    fr.dmdt_first AS initial_rise_estimate,
    nd.fid,
    nd.mjd,
    nd.diffmaglim
FROM object o
JOIN sn_objects sn ON o.oid = sn.oid
JOIN fast_risers fr ON o.oid = fr.oid
JOIN non_detection nd ON o.oid = nd.oid
WHERE o.firstmjd BETWEEN 60188.0 AND 60189.0  -- First 2 days of September
ORDER BY o.oid
LIMIT 100;

-- Query to find objects classified as asteroids with high probability that appeared once between March 1-April 1, 2021
SELECT 
    o.oid,
    o.meanra,
    o.meandec,
    o.ndet,
    o.firstmjd,
    p.class_name,
    p.probability
FROM 
    object o
JOIN 
    probability p ON o.oid = p.oid
WHERE 
    o.firstmjd BETWEEN 59274.0 AND 59305.0  -- Between March 1st and April 1st 2021
    AND o.ndet <= 1  -- At most one detection
    AND p.classifier_name = 'stamp_classifier'  -- Using stamp classifier
    AND p.class_name = 'asteroid'  -- Classified as asteroid
    AND p.probability > 0.7  -- With probability greater than 0.7
    AND p.ranking = 1;  -- Most likely class

-- Query to retrieve specified information for the given list of oids with filtering conditions
WITH target_objects AS (
    SELECT unnest(ARRAY['ZTF23aavzgjg', 'ZTF23aaynzyk', 'ZTF23aavqxos', 'ZTF23aaknyni',
                        'ZTF23aavsdtc', 'ZTF18aandkua', 'ZTF23aaxfewt', 'ZTF23aavshwi',
                        'ZTF22aawasao', 'ZTF23aaxgvnt']) AS oid
)
SELECT 
    d.oid,                -- unique object identifier
    d.candid,             -- candidate identifier
    d.fid,                -- filter identifier
    d.mjd,                -- modified julian date
    d.magpsf_corr,        -- magnitude
    d.sigmapsf_corr,      -- magnitude error
    d.has_stamp,          -- whether the object has stamps
    d.drb,                -- deep learning real bogus score
    ps.sgscore1,          -- star galaxy score of the nearest object
    ps.distpsnr1          -- distance to the nearest source in panstarrs
FROM 
    target_objects t
JOIN 
    detection d ON d.oid = t.oid
JOIN 
    ps1_ztf ps ON d.oid = ps.oid AND d.candid = ps.candid
WHERE 
    d.drb > 0.5
    AND (ps.sgscore1 < 0.5 OR ps.distpsnr1 < 1);

-- Query to retrieve specified information for the given list of oids with filtering conditions
WITH target_objects AS (
    SELECT unnest(ARRAY['ZTF23aavzgjg', 'ZTF23aaynzyk', 'ZTF23aavqxos', 'ZTF23aaknyni',
                        'ZTF23aavsdtc', 'ZTF18aandkua', 'ZTF23aaxfewt', 'ZTF23aavshwi',
                        'ZTF22aawasao', 'ZTF23aaxgvnt']) AS oid
)
SELECT 
    d.oid,                -- unique object identifier
    d.candid,             -- candidate identifier
    d.fid,                -- filter identifier
    d.mjd,                -- modified julian date
    d.magpsf_corr,        -- magnitude
    d.sigmapsf_corr,      -- magnitude error
    d.has_stamp,          -- whether the object has stamps
    d.drb,                -- deep learning real bogus score
    ps.sgscore1,          -- star galaxy score of the nearest object
    ps.distpsnr1          -- distance to the nearest source in panstarrs
FROM 
    target_objects t
JOIN 
    detection d ON d.oid = t.oid
JOIN 
    ps1_ztf ps ON d.oid = ps.oid AND d.candid = ps.candid
WHERE 
    d.drb > 0.5
    AND (ps.sgscore1 < 0.5 OR ps.distpsnr1 < 1)
ORDER BY 
    d.oid, d.mjd;

-- Find objects detected between June 1st and July 1st 2018 (MJD 58239.0 to 58270.0)
-- that have been classified by the light curve classifier
SELECT o.*
FROM object o
WHERE o.firstmjd BETWEEN 58239.0 AND 58270.0
AND EXISTS (
    SELECT 1
    FROM probability p
    WHERE p.oid = o.oid
    AND p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier'
    AND p.ranking = 1
);

-- Get all SNe (supernovae) that first occurred between Feb 13 and Sep 10, 2023
-- and are within the specified polygon
SELECT 
    o.oid,
    o.meanra,
    o.meandec
FROM 
    object o
WHERE 
    -- First detection between Feb 13 and Sep 10, 2023
    o.firstmjd BETWEEN 59988.0 AND 60197.0
    -- Check if the object is within the specified polygon
    AND point(o.meanra, o.meandec) <@ '((-20, -20), (-2, -20), (20, 1), (10, 10))'::polygon
    -- Get only objects classified as supernovae (any type)
    AND EXISTS (
        SELECT 1
        FROM probability p
        WHERE p.oid = o.oid
        AND p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier'
        AND p.ranking = 1
        AND p.class_name IN ('SNIa', 'SNIbc', 'SNII', 'SLSN')
    );

WITH catalog (source_id, ra, dec, radius) AS (
    VALUES 
        ('id_1', 354.67, 15.954, 30.0/3600.0),  -- 30 arcsec converted to degrees
        ('id_2', 20.7993, 1.00331, 20.0/3600.0)  -- 20 arcsec converted to degrees
)
SELECT 
    c.source_id AS input_id,
    c.ra AS input_ra,
    c.dec AS input_dec,
    c.radius AS search_radius_deg,
    o.oid AS ztf_id,
    o.ndet AS num_detections,
    o.meanra AS ztf_ra,
    o.meandec AS ztf_dec,
    o.firstmjd AS first_detection_date
FROM 
    catalog c,
    object o
WHERE 
    q3c_radial_query(o.meanra, o.meandec, c.ra, c.dec, c.radius)
ORDER BY 
    o.lastmjd DESC;

-- Query to retrieve r-band epochs from dataquality table for specific ZTF objects
SELECT 
    oid, -- ZTF identifier
    candid, -- candidate identifier
    xpos, -- x-image position in pixels
    ypos, -- y-image position in pixels
    scorr -- peak-pixel signal-to-noise ratio
FROM 
    dataquality
WHERE 
    oid IN ('ZTF20acwrybw', 'ZTF22abugigx')
    AND fid = 2 -- Filter ID 2 corresponds to r-band
ORDER BY 
    oid, 
    candid;

-- Find at most 50 ZTF objects that are likely supernovae according to stamp classifier
-- First get the OIDs of objects with probability > 0.7 of being SN in stamp classifier
WITH sn_objects AS (
    SELECT oid
    FROM probability
    WHERE classifier_name = 'stamp_classifier'
      AND class_name = 'SN'
      AND probability > 0.7
    LIMIT 50
)
-- Then retrieve all dataquality information for these objects
SELECT dq.*
FROM dataquality dq

-- Find ZTF objects with PS1 distance > 5 arcsec and non-SN probability > 0.7
WITH candidate_objects AS (
    -- Get objects with PS1 distance > 5 arcsec
    SELECT DISTINCT ps.oid
    FROM ps1_ztf ps
    WHERE ps.distpsnr1 > 5
),
non_sn_objects AS (
    -- Get objects with probability > 0.7 for non-SN classes in lc_classifier
    SELECT DISTINCT p.oid
    FROM probability p
    WHERE p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier'
      AND p.ranking = 1
      AND p.probability > 0.7
      AND p.class_name NOT IN ('SNIa', 'SNIbc', 'SNII', 'SLSN')
)
SELECT o.*, p.*, ps.*
FROM object o
JOIN probability p ON o.oid = p.oid
JOIN ps1_ztf ps ON o.oid = ps.oid
WHERE o.oid IN (SELECT oid FROM candidate_objects)
  AND o.oid IN (SELECT oid FROM non_sn_objects)
  AND p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier'
  AND p.ranking = 1
ORDER BY ps.distpsnr1 DESC
LIMIT 200;

-- Find ZTF objects with at least 10 detections in g band (fid=1) with no dubious corrections
-- Return top class (ranking=1) from light curve classifier
WITH valid_objects AS (
    SELECT 
        d.oid
    FROM 
        detection d
    WHERE 
        d.fid = 1 -- g band
        AND d.dubious = FALSE
    GROUP BY 
        d.oid
    HAVING 
        COUNT(*) >= 10
)
SELECT 
    o.oid AS "ZTF identifier",
    p.classifier_version AS "classifier version",
    p.class_name AS "class name",
    p.probability AS "probability"
FROM 
    object o
JOIN 
    probability p ON o.oid = p.oid
WHERE 
    o.oid IN (SELECT oid FROM valid_objects)
    AND p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier'
    AND p.ranking = 1
ORDER BY 
    o.oid
LIMIT 500;

-- Find ZTF objects with at least 10 detections in g band (fid=1) with no dubious corrections

WITH valid_objects AS (
    SELECT DISTINCT d.oid
    FROM detection d
    WHERE d.fid = 1  -- g band
      AND d.dubious = FALSE
    GROUP BY d.oid
    HAVING COUNT(*) >= 10
)
SELECT 
    o.oid AS "ZTF identifier",
    p.classifier_version AS "classifier version",
    p.class_name AS "class name",
    p.probability AS "probability"
FROM 
    object o
JOIN

WHERE

    AND p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier'
    AND p.ranking = 1
ORDER BY

LIMIT 500;

-- Find ZTF objects that are AGNs with specific WISE W1 magnitude range
WITH agn_objects AS (
    SELECT p.oid
    FROM probability p
    WHERE p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier'
      AND p.class_name = 'AGN'
      AND p.probability > 0.6
      AND p.ranking = 1
),
wise_objects AS (
    SELECT x.oid
    FROM agn_objects a
    JOIN xmatch x ON a.oid = x.oid
    JOIN allwise w ON x.oid_catalog = w.oid_catalog
    WHERE w.w1mpro BETWEEN 12 AND 13
    LIMIT 50
)
SELECT m.*
FROM magstat m
JOIN wise_objects w ON m.oid = w.oid;

-- Find ZTF objects that are likely AGNs with specific WISE W1 magnitude range
WITH agn_objects AS (
    SELECT p.oid
    FROM probability p
    WHERE p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier'
      AND p.class_name = 'AGN'
      AND p.probability > 0.6
)
SELECT m.*
FROM magstat m
WHERE m.oid IN (
    SELECT a.oid
    FROM agn_objects a
    JOIN object o ON a.oid = o.oid
    JOIN xmatch x ON o.oid = x.oid
    JOIN allwise w ON x.oid_catalog = w.oid_catalog
    WHERE w.w1mpro BETWEEN 12 AND 13
)
LIMIT 50;

-- Find ZTF objects with >500 detections, high asteroid probability, and close to known Solar System objects
SELECT 
    o.oid AS ztf_identifier,
    o.ndet AS number_of_detections,
    o.firstmjd AS first_detection_date,
    o.lastmjd AS last_detection_date,
    p.probability AS asteroid_probability,
    s.candid AS candidate_identifier,
    s.ssdistnr AS distance_to_mpc_object,
    s.ssnamenr AS mpc_name,
    d.mjd AS detection_date,
    d.fid AS filter_identifier
FROM 
    object o
JOIN 
    probability p ON o.oid = p.oid
JOIN 
    ss_ztf s ON o.oid = s.oid
JOIN 
    detection d ON o.oid = d.oid AND s.candid = d.candid
WHERE 
    o.ndet > 500
    AND p.class_name = 'asteroid'
    AND p.classifier_name = 'stamp_classifier'
    AND p.classifier_version = 'stamp_classifier_1.0.4'
    AND p.probability > 0.5
    AND s.ssdistnr < 2  -- Distance in arcseconds
ORDER BY 
    o.firstmjd
LIMIT 10;

-- Find objects with multiband period < 5 days and return their top 2 probabilities
WITH period_objects AS (
    SELECT DISTINCT oid
    FROM feature
    WHERE name = 'Multiband_period'
      AND value < 5
      AND version = 'lc_classifier_1.2.1-P'
    LIMIT 100
)
SELECT p.*
FROM probability p
JOIN period_objects po ON p.oid = po.oid
WHERE p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier'
  AND p.ranking IN (1, 2)
ORDER BY p.oid, p.ranking;

      AND version = 'lc_classifier_1.2.1-P'
    LIMIT 100
)

ORDER BY p.oid, p.ranking;

-- Find ZTF objects that are likely bogus and transient
WITH bogus_objects AS (
    SELECT p.oid
    FROM probability p
    WHERE p.classifier_name = 'stamp_classifier'
      AND p.classifier_version = 'stamp_classifier_1.0.4'
      AND p.class_name = 'bogus'
      AND p.probability > 0.7
),
transient_objects AS (
    SELECT p.oid
    FROM probability p
    WHERE p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier_top'
      AND p.class_name = 'Transient'
      AND p.probability > 0.9
)
SELECT 
    o.oid AS "ZTF identifier",
    o.ndet AS "number of detections",
    o.firstmjd AS "first detection date",
    p_bogus.probability AS prob_stamp_bogus,
    p_transient.probability AS prob_lc_transient
FROM object o
JOIN bogus_objects bo ON o.oid = bo.oid
JOIN transient_objects to_obj ON o.oid = to_obj.oid
JOIN probability p_bogus ON o.oid = p_bogus.oid 
    AND p_bogus.classifier_name = 'stamp_classifier' 
    AND p_bogus.classifier_version = 'stamp_classifier_1.0.4'
    AND p_bogus.class_name = 'bogus'
JOIN probability p_transient ON o.oid = p_transient.oid 
    AND p_transient.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier_top'
    AND p_transient.class_name = 'Transient'
WHERE o.ndet > 10
ORDER BY o.oid
LIMIT 30;

-- Get at most 20 ZTF objects with specific conditions
WITH g_band_min AS (
    SELECT 
        oid,
        MIN(magpsf_corr) AS min_g_mag
    FROM 
        detection
    WHERE 
        fid = 1 -- g-band filter
        AND corrected = TRUE
    GROUP BY 
        oid
),
r_band_min AS (
    SELECT 
        oid,
        MIN(magpsf_corr) AS min_r_mag
    FROM 
        detection
    WHERE 
        fid = 2 -- r-band filter
        AND corrected = TRUE
    GROUP BY 
        oid
),
candidate_objects AS (
    SELECT 
        o.oid
    FROM 
        object o
        JOIN g_band_min g ON o.oid = g.oid
        JOIN r_band_min r ON o.oid = r.oid
    WHERE 
        o.ndet >= 30 -- minimum number of detections
        AND o.deltajd > 20 -- difference between last and first detection > 20 days
        AND ABS(g.min_g_mag - r.min_r_mag) > 3.5 -- difference between min g and r magnitudes > 3.5
    LIMIT 20
)
SELECT 
    *
FROM 
    object
WHERE 
    oid IN (SELECT oid FROM candidate_objects);

-- Get CV/Nova objects from stochastic classifier with ndet <= 50
WITH cv_nova_objects AS (
    SELECT o.oid
    FROM object o
    JOIN probability p ON o.oid = p.oid
    WHERE p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier_stochastic'
      AND p.class_name = 'CV/Nova'
      AND p.ranking = 1
      AND o.ndet <= 50
)
-- Select detections in r-band for these objects
SELECT 
    d.oid AS object_identifier,
    d.candid AS candidate_identifier,
    d.fid AS f_id,
    d.ra,
    d.dec,
    d.magpsf_corr AS magnitude,
    d.sigmapsf_corr AS magnitude_error,
    (MAX(d.magpsf_corr) OVER (PARTITION BY d.oid) - MIN(d.magpsf_corr) OVER (PARTITION BY d.oid)) AS max_rise
FROM detection d
JOIN cv_nova_objects c ON d.oid = c.oid
WHERE d.fid = 2  -- r-band filter (fid=2)
ORDER BY d.oid
LIMIT 1000;

-- Get CV/Nova objects from stochastic classifier with ndet <= 50
WITH cv_nova_objects AS (
    SELECT o.oid
    FROM object o
    JOIN probability p ON o.oid = p.oid
    WHERE p.classifier_name = 'lc_classifier_stochastic'
    AND p.class_name = 'CV/Nova'
    AND p.ranking = 1  -- Most probable class
    AND o.ndet <= 50
)
-- Get r-band detections for these objects
SELECT 
    d.oid AS object_identifier,
    d.candid AS candidate_identifier,
    d.fid AS f_id,
    d.ra,
    d.dec,
    d.magpsf AS magnitude,
    d.sigmapsf AS magnitude_error,
    d.magpsf_corr AS corrected_magnitude,
    d.sigmapsf_corr AS corrected_magnitude_error,
    (MAX(d.magpsf_corr) OVER (PARTITION BY d.oid) - MIN(d.magpsf_corr) OVER (PARTITION BY d.oid)) AS max_rise
FROM detection d
WHERE d.oid IN (SELECT oid FROM cv_nova_objects)
AND d.fid = 2  -- r-band filter (fid=2)
ORDER BY d.oid
LIMIT 1000;
